website_summaries.verdict: A classically styled remote that can control the entire media center of a home, offering many of the same features as smartphone-controlled remotes.
pros: Easy to configure through Windows or Mac computers, users find, with intuitive programming help available
Analog buttons are a good backup for the small touch screen
Good customer service and tech support
cons: Reports of remote failing after a few months
Multitasking between devices can mean a lot of button pushing
Not compatible with certain streaming devices like the Fire Stick
Device can go into reset loop

website_summaries.verdict: Easily the best on the market right now. User-friendly controls and consistent performance separate it from the rest of the pack.
pros: A top choice for its crisp, bright color screen – complete with icons – and its ability to support numerous brands and devices
cons: It may take you a while to figure out how to correctly program the remote

website_summaries.verdict: The Logitech Harmony 650 is one of the best universal remotes you can buy for less than $100.
pros: Powerful universal remote with great ergonomics
color LCD screen surrounded by five contextual buttons
Web programmable via Windows or Mac PCs
excellent button layout and overall design
cons: adding favorite channel icons is a bit more difficult than it should be
an additional $20 gets you the step-up model rechargeable batteries

customer_reviews.title: Not terribly impressed
customer_reviews.text: Not terribly impressed. It works and controls everything perfectly, but you constantly have to switch back and forth through button sequences to accomplish the simplest of tasks, which can get annoying. Personally, I really prefer the simplicity of the Harmony 350 and would definitely have bought another were the buttons on the 350 not so cheaply made and quick to wear out and the fact the buttons aren't backlit. Still, I think I'd rather deal with replacing a 350 every time the warranty expires than put up with the annoyingly overly complex 650. If you love to push buttons and scroll through menus to accomplish the simplest of tasks, then the 650 is the remote for you.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ainsworth

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 6 months - Problem appears to be solved
customer_reviews.text: Purchased six months ago - functioned well until a couple of days ago when it would no longer operate with my TV, cable box, audio amplifier and cable box. Tried all online remedies to no avail - resetting, safe mode, re-Sync at MyHarmony.com, etc. Update - I received an email response from Logitech Support suggesting replacement of the AA batteries. Although the batteries are recent and appear to be charged and working, I replaced them with new AA Energizer Lithium and the remote appears to be working properly again. Logitech Support responded to my email inquiry within about 24 hours and their prompt response is appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Malachi1

customer_reviews.title: Nice for what it is but not as universal as I'd like
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it won't control my Amazon Fire TV stick, which has a newer bluetooth or WiFi interface. The evolving consumer device space complicates the universal remote scene. While remote this may be adequate or good for people who only have IR remote controlled devices, IR (Infrared) alone is not good enough to cover the gamut of newer media devices. So I returned it. If I get a remote I will end up paying more for one that covers more devices. Unfortunately the 'ideal' solutions in this space aren't still completely mature yet, and the really good ones push up between $200-$300. And my requirement is to have two remote controls even if I have one that is a central hub.
customer_reviews.author: Fixer-upper

customer_reviews.title: Best Affordable IR programmable remote out there.
customer_reviews.text: We have these all over the house, and several in our big RV. Easy to program (online with a USB cable). Seems to have support for almost any IR device, and easy learning mode for any others. Almost always works, even with complicated “macro like” multi device setups. Example: Turn A on, wait 7 seconds, change input, turn B on, wait 6 seconds, change channel, etc. Recovers easily if your devices get “out of sync” with step-by-step “did that fix the problem” interactive help. Versatile. Seemingly indestructible. Inexpensive. Did you know you can control your Luminara LED candles with this too?
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Very good - about half the time
customer_reviews.text: Presents chronic issues of units not powering on and/or properly switching input assignments on two different common devices. About 50% of the time I have to use the nagging help process to resolve failed actions of one sort or another. The other 50% everything works fine and proves it is programmed correctly. Obviously, this extra work is very counterproductive when using a product that is specifically designed to conserve effort, and consequently renders the product unusable. Disappointed. Edit: After a final round of trouble shooting and a failure of this company to provide any sort of support, I have lowered my review to 1-star. This is worthless junk.
customer_reviews.author: tomerson

customer_reviews.title: accept no substitutes
customer_reviews.text: tried a few cheaper IR universal remotes that "learn" the buttons of other remotes with no success before I finally spent a little more on the famous Harmony. Complex proprietary commands like Samsung's "smarthub" were too much for the competition yet worked instantly with the Harmony. All I can say is accept no substitutes and you get what you pay for. In expert mode, I can see every possible command in the Samsung UHDTV and pick which buttons they go to. Had the whole thing masterfully setup in under 20 mins. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in SLC

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to set up. Not user friendly. At least there is tech support that set it up for me and I can call them anytime.
customer_reviews.text: Had a hell of a time setting this up. Not very friendly. Nothing worked. Had to call tech support and they told me I had to have a TV in the "activities" in order to work. Well my TV is a 40 inch touch screen monitor so the tech guy put in a Sony TV and it finally worked. I wish the instructions told me that I had to have a TV in the activities to work. Then it couldn't find the Apple TV and that was way more difficult than it should be. The programmers who programmed this need to get out more and experience some real life. They can make this stuff a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Field Medic

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity can complicate
customer_reviews.text: While this device has simplified our lives from 3 remotes to 1, it has complicated the family’s ability to get features functional. The 1-button promises for TV, Streaming, etc. do not sync well and we’re constantly having to reset with prompts on the remote, which still don’t resolve the issues long-term. I’m sure my wife would rather go back to 3 separate remotes, but she is trying to be a troooper. I have a wee bit more patience than she does, only because this was my idea. Sometimes simplifying leads to complicating.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Mabry

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this remote for several months. The concept and design are great, setup was easy, but the execution is flawed. Remote assistant constantly pops up and it doesn’t always give the option to exit. Need to use the Help button fairly regularly because it doesn’t turn on/off all of the programmed devices for the preset options. Difficult to read the buttons unless you have good light or perfect eyesight (recent eye exam, dr said no need for reading glasses but it’s still hard to read the remote). This would be okay if you’re lucky enough to be able to memorize the buttons easily. This still eliminates the clutter but at what cost. Not sure we’re sticking with it.
customer_reviews.author: J.S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work consistently
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote to help my elderly parents be able to control their entertainment devices. they're getting up there in age and needed some assistance turning on and off the different components base on what they were watching. I thought this could be a good remote for them. It was not. it wouldn't switch from watching TV to watch a DVD appropriately. When powering off the system from watching TV and then go back in to watch DVD and it wouldn't turn on the correct components. the help guide on the remote wasn't helpful for them. I returned this remote.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: It works, but it is not the high tech remote I expected.
customer_reviews.text: This all in one remote is easy to program. All you need is the model number of your component. Once programed you are able to use most of the function of your component remotes with this product. Unfortunately, this remote has to be reprogramed almost daily. It has a help function and if the remote does not control the right component, you can go through the help functions until the component response to the remote. This get annoying and I have to go through this process almost every time I use it. It's okay, but I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Robinson

customer_reviews.title: While I love programmable remotes
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these. While I love programmable remotes, these ones seem to have a lot of problems. They keep resetting themselves when the battery gets low (it appears to eat through batteries) and when it takes a fall off the couch. I have to go through an annoying tutorial every time it resets. Also, having two is not as beneficial because the second remote will not know the status of anything so it isn't able to adjust things like volume without hitting a few keys first.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: works ok
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work OK. Wife is having a little bit o trouble getting used to it but she is female and thinks one button should both turn on everything in the world and operate every possible function. Wonder if Logitech will ever build that remote - one huge red button that just says push for off/on and all functions haha. They could call it the " Skynet T-3000" haha ~
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Robert

customer_reviews.title: Much simpler than you think
customer_reviews.text: This remote is simply amazing. If you are like I was and pictured a universal remote similar to what they were in the 90's you are completely wrong. It is incredibly simple to program, you simply plug it into your computer with the provided USB cable download their software and go step by step what you want the remote to do. There is no reading a series of codes and manually programming them in for each devise. I have it to control my Samsung TV, Sony Blueray, DirecTV reciever, and Bose Lifestyle V20 system. The only downfall is the remote might be smarter than me.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Romig

customer_reviews.title: easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Convenient to setup and use. Compatible with everything I have including Xbox One. 2 Cons: 1) at the end of the setup. the device never says it has finished., But it did. Just wait for a while to be sure all settings were downloaded. 2) some buttons are failing to respond. Sometimes there is an alternative but in some cases no. So need to replace after 4 years of use. This was the second controller after the first one failed in the same way.
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: Utter Garbage
customer_reviews.text: If you can ever get it set up, it generally works ok. Buts that's a pretty big if. The software is atrocious, and has been for years. Logitech apparently has no interest in maintaining it. After spending the time to set everything up, the Sync button does nothing. Every time. I'll try various combinations of rebooting the remote, connecting it, or starting the software first, or syncing before connecting, or logging out then back in. After a dozen times or so it'll randomly work. I still have no idea how to reliably get it to work though.
customer_reviews.author: A. Roddy

customer_reviews.title: It’s fine for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This remote is compatible with my TCL Roku TV and my Visio sound bar, so that’s great. The activities feature is pretty nice but I haven’t really explored that too much. My biggest gripe is it sometimes forgets what it’s doing so I have to cycle through a power off/power on routine to get the remote to work again. There’s an assistant that tries to help out but in my opinion the remote relies on that too much to keep operating. It almost constantly asks if everything turned on or off correctly every time I use the remote. What’s the point in programming it if the remote itself is unsure of what’s going on? This thing needs a confidence upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: instamatic

customer_reviews.title: Self from 2 years ago, this is your future self.  Just buy this remote.
customer_reviews.text: If I could time-travel, I would go back in time to tell myself 2 years ago to stop struggling with multple remotes and just buy this product. Then I would create world peace. Then buy a winning lottery ticket; in that order. This remote is life changing and amazing to use once everyone is setup. The online installation tool made this setup SEEMLESS. I'm learning new shortcuts/ programs every day and it makes things so much easier for my mother (who needs closed captioning) and my kids who used to have to ask for help with 3 separate remotes to swithc from TV to a DVD movie.
customer_reviews.author: Dv44

customer_reviews.title: Best remote ever cant believe I haven't discovered it sooner
customer_reviews.text: 1. its super easy to setup simply plug the USB cable in and download the app from Logitech took me 15 minutes to have it fully customized to my massive component needs. 2.totally able to customize any component button to work with in any modes I.E. watch Tv, watch movies buttons. 3. disable the tilt sensor Via the app and sync the setting so the remote does not run the batteries dead faster when you move the remote. 4. don't just order one you'll see what I mean instantly after its in your hands fully setup I ordered 2 more after discovering how well it works and how easy it is to setup.
customer_reviews.author: LovesAmazonShopping

customer_reviews.title: Good, but device # limited & no control of each device options Logitech software makes you deal with
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace my power hungry Proton iR800. This has more devices covered but some result in an enormous volume of irrelevant functions added in needlessly. My Yamaha audio receiver was given video controls and surround sound controls even though it has none of as much. Some common devices have no coverage such as HP computers like the HDX18t & DV8 remote controls. All in all a good enough remote but with very little customization and no ability to alter/remove unnecessary controls the Windows Logitech software installs. But the 2 AA's provide 60 times the lifespan of my former Proton's 4 AAA's (560 days with Fujitsu NiMH rechargables versus 14 days with the Proton's use of 2x the batteries).
customer_reviews.author: DAVID W.

customer_reviews.title: Great universal remote
customer_reviews.text: After years of trying to find a universal remote that would replace the original remotes that came with the devices, this one does the trick. I read most of the user guide before beginning installation and found the online instruction very intuitive. Programming two smart TV's, two satellite receiver boxes, two DVD players, one A/V receiver and one power control for a sound bar went smoothly on my MacBook Pro with The latest OSX software and was pleasantly surprised to find that most of the functions of the original remotes were onboard. I now have two Harmony 650's that replaced seven or eight original remotes. Way to go Logitech
customer_reviews.author: FortunaGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great remote, works with everything I own, including some extremely off brand products.
customer_reviews.text: I never knew I needed a universal remote until I started using this one. I bought this because we purchased an off brand soundbar for our living room that our cable box remote would not control. I found one answer on the soundbar questions page that recommended the Logitech Harmony line, so I gave this one a shot. I'm glad I did. This remote has all of the controls I need for every device I use, including the soundbar. There are some pricier models that I'm sure work just as well with other functions, but I didn't see a need for all of that, and spending hundreds of dollars on them. This one does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Dale K

customer_reviews.title: F$#@ING THING SUCKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worst Amazon purchase ever, and I've purchased a lot. I wasted so much time gathering and inserting my devices' model numbers and supposedly synching everything up using my Mac, only to find the remote did nothing. Changed batteries, re-installed, re-synched, rebooted, and still no sign of life--not a single function worked, not even a little. Extremely frustrating! Somebody get me a xanax. I have a new appreciation for the simplicity of simply using separate remotes for my different devices. How the hell did this P.O.S. get four stars? Of course I'll be returning it for a refund but frankly I should send Logitech a bill for all the hours I spent trying to get this piece of garbage to work.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo A-Go-Go

customer_reviews.title: Generally a fan of  Logitech's
customer_reviews.text: I generally love Logitech (Owning a G19s, G502, G700s , G29, and Z5500, Pro Keyboard for my Tablet, among others), but this thing was dismal. From the moment I got it, every pair of batteries I put into it would drain after a couple of seconds, and I'm not sure as to why. I wish I could have returned it, but I only used it about 3 months after I bought it, when our primary remote got really Lost. I have since thrown the product away - an unusual dark spot in an otherwise bright history of Logitech Products.
customer_reviews.author: Dradien

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Frontier FIOS Arris Box and no more complicated setup like the old days
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend for those of us with the horrible frontier remote. Haven't found a single function missing for the frontier fios cable box. TCL Roku TV control is flawless and it operates all the built in apps. Setup took maybe 10 minutes and is super easy. I remember the days of entering codes and teaching the remote macros, well those days are gone! EQUIPMENT - CONTROL FUNCTION Frontier Arris VMS1100 - Perfect Control Apple TV - Perfect Control Marantz PM6006 - Perfect Control TCL Roku TV 55C803 - Perfect Control
customer_reviews.author: Evets Ikcerohop

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly USER FRIENDLY and easy to set up All FOR VERY Reasonable Price.
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly impressive from the setup process especially to how well it works in adjusting to rapidly learning exactly how all the features on linked items should work. I only wish I had purchased this much sooner. Will consider upgrading at some point to device that links to Alexa and allows for voice commands. WELL MADE, High Quality Product at very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Sal G.

customer_reviews.title: Really good but short life
customer_reviews.text: I really like this remote but after about two & half years, several buttons started getting harder & harder to get to work until they just stopped working completely. Now, I guess this says something that I ordered another one to replace but I think it should have lasted longer. The remote never got wet or abused in any way. It seems like the contacts just wore out. So, good remote but questionable quality. I think if you go in with the knowledge that it is pretty reasonably priced but it is probably going to last about three years, it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES B HARRIS

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect all-in-one remote
customer_reviews.text: This remote fit my needs perfectly. Adequately controls all my electronic media to support 6 audio and visual systems (LG, Yamaha, JVC, Roku, Pioneer, DTV). Was not difficult to setup and the learning feature was helpful. Took a couple of tries to get all the required functions on there, but that wasn't a big deal for me. The infrared beam in a little narrower than my other remotes so sometimes I get a little frustrated with getting the aim right. However, I was able to ditch all the other remotes. You won't be disappointed as long as you have a little patience in the initial setup.
customer_reviews.author: Kram

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Took a couple of tries to get set up properly but the software seems intuitive and learns from my programing mistakes. This one control replaced 6 remotes! Love the single function buttons that will set up all required devices for TV, or DVD or ROKU. Best remote ever, replaced an older Logitech Harmony 659 that we had for over 15 years (some buttons got tired). Looking forward to another 15 years of usage.
customer_reviews.author: T. Moses

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote and easy to program but.....
customer_reviews.text: This remote control was very easy to program. All I had to do was log in and register the manufacturer and model number of the devices I need to control. I was very disappointed when the remote control was able to detect my Bose speakers but gave me a message that the remote does not broadcast the frequency needed to control volume on the Bose system. I would have not purchased the remote had I known it cannot control Bose speakers. So now I am still left with multiple remote controllers. Disappointing!
customer_reviews.author: George M

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long to buy?
customer_reviews.text: I've been putting up with my Yamaha remote being flakey - and putting off buying a replacment, all the while juggling four other remotes to control my dvr, dvd, tv and cd player. Now withing ten minutes - I have all the functionality of the five on one remote - and can turn on multiple devices with one button push. So easy to set up. The only con - I wanted to sign in to the software with my Google account - rather than creating a new account with Logitech - but for whatever reason it would never connect to Google. Not a deal breaker - just time wasted trying to get it to work multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: James Hatz

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Loves Batteries
customer_reviews.text: Because it eats them as though they are going out of style. Six sets of batteries in nearly as many months. One thing to note, it was not delivered as New-In-Box and I suspect (only a suspected thought) this was a returned item which the seller bought on the secondary market and sold as new. Otherwise - the remote itself is great. No more trying to set everything up for my wife each time she wants to watch TV, Roku, DVD, or just listen to music. Definitely a sanity saver (although an expensive one when cost of batteries are considered)
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget universal remote
customer_reviews.text: I have owned harmony remotes for many years. The biggest problem is always the software, which they never seemed to update, so you always ran into compatibility issues. It seems now they have finally done their job, and have updated the software to include many newer electronic offerings, like Apple TV. So now I was able to finally program this remote to control the Apple TV, you just use the directional arrows and center OK button on the remote to enter your commands. This is the perfect budget universal remote control.
customer_reviews.author: Hill1

customer_reviews.title: Probably one of the worst product purchases I have made in a long time
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the worst product purchases I have made in a long time. Purchased based on the 4+ star reviews. This thing would not sync or stay connected long enough to complete the sync. I tried a powered USB hub because on their user support forum someone mentioned it requires more power than a standard computer port can provide. Doing that enabled the sync process to at least start. Makes it 25% then says it lost connection, unplug, wait a few seconds and try again. It never worked and if this is what is required to get it to work, then way too many hoops to jump through to reprogram a remote.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: Software is terrible
customer_reviews.text: It's not terrible onceset up, but it is a total nightmare to program because of the redonkulous software. It recognizes devices readily, but I can't seem to tailor it exactly like I want. Once you finally get it, Lock your old remotes up and out of sight because the moment you press a button on one of the originals, it will screw up the functions on this one. If you're lucky, it will reset itself to your programmed settings, but if not, you'll have to start from ground zero. Nonetheless, it has taken the place of 5 remotes. That's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: DarkSnart

customer_reviews.title: Laggy - button response too slow
customer_reviews.text: I never could fix the inexplicable button delay on this remote. No amount of fiddling with inter-key delay and inter-device delay settings could get this remote to be as responsive as a cheap universal remote. This is especially noticeable with Apple TV or any other streaming box that occasionally requires text input. If you have a streaming box of any kind, don't buy this remote. If you only have simple devices like blueray players and such, this remote will work fine. The programmability is really cool; I just can't understand why Logitech hobbled an otherwise good product with laggy buttons.
customer_reviews.author: BoxmanOKC

customer_reviews.title: Small screen and does not replace 2016 LG Smart TV Remote
customer_reviews.text: The screen is very small and not easy to read. It has a quadrant screen design that makes navigation hard when trying to use it to replace all the features of an LG Smart TV remote. It does not have intuitive navigation. This was suppose to replace my 2016 LG remote that stopped working - making my TV useless for Smart TV features like watching YouTube, etc. But after struggling for a few weeks, I decided to go ahead and order a replacement LG remote from the LG website. I was disappointed to have to do so since the LG remote cost quite a bit of money and took a while to receive.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Does not consistently work.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the product for about 4 months. When it works it is fine. It does not work consistently. It requires messing with the settings on a regular basis. Examples: Moves through TV menus too quickly. Often loads an SD (narrow picture) instead of a full-screen picture. Often must load Apple TV first and then load cable. It is a total waste of money because we still have three remotes on the table just in case this remote doesn't work. I purchased based on wirecutter which has been traditionally reliable - not the case on this product. I have a Vizio TV, Apple TV, and a Cable box.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: For folks that have multiple remotes you have got to get this remote! Received our first one as a Christmas present years ago and have not looked back! Our original Harmony finally started to give-it-up. Found this one on Amazon that is almost identical to our first one except this one does not have rechargeable batteries - which is really no big deal. Programming the remote was no problem, mainly because I already had all of our devices entered into the Logitech/Harmony site. Took about 5 minutes to program and it has worked fine every since. Even if you have to start from scratch it doesn't take long and i can't imagine anyone having difficulty with the directions.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent,Excellent! I saw that some people had problems getting this set up,Not anymore the new software walks you through everything. You setup an account ,download the software. Do your home work find the make and model of the equipment you want to setup before you run the software. Then the software guides you through the rest of the steps. When the software shows you are at 99% done after a few beeps on you computer ,your finished ,check the lcd screen. DON'T FORGET TO TAKE OFF THE SCREEN PROTECTOR ON THE LCD SCREEN. The whole setup took less than 20 minutes. I am very happy with this remote. One remote replaces 6 remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Glider43

customer_reviews.title: So-so product - doesn't always work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Logitech to replace my Apple TV, Onkyo receiver, Spectrum Box and Samsung TV controller and Samsung DVD player remote. When it works, it's great but most of the time one has to press the "help" button to tell it which devices did not turn on. It does take a little bit of programming (cable connected to remote to your laptop) to select the various devices you're looking to program. Although I still use it, not overly impressed because I still resort to my original remotes to turn TV on/off when this one fails.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: OK to reduce remotes, not the most user friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Remote requires changing between devices to use the specific functions (e.g. channel selection and volume) regardless of setting global parameters as the soundbar is specific for volume control in the "Watch TV" function and channels are to be controlled by the cable box under the same function. Having to switch back and forth between cable box and soundbar to control channel and volume defeats the purpose of an all-in-one remote. The downloaded application for Windows works well and does encompass a vast variety of devices, so the platform for the Logitech universal remotes should be able to work with the majority of your devices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A big headache
customer_reviews.text: Remote is trouble. The desktop software is buggy and if you don't have the exact USB cord sent with the remote you will not be able to program it as the computer will not recognize the USB connection. I just spent 3 hours trying 20 different cables and thank god I found the original in the garage. Also, the IR remote requires you to point directly at the device, not like the Roku or Amazon Fire remotes. If you have a cabinet with an audio receiver, Blue-ray or other device and a living room table it interferes with the signal. I bought 2 at the same time and really sorry I did.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first programmable remote. It has mostly been used to control my TV and cable box, and I programmed it to automatically turn both on with one touch. It works well 95% of the time. However, 5% of the time it either doesn't send the power signal to the TV or the TV just doesn't see it. That means a few more button pushes to navigate the menu in the remote to be able to turn on the TV. Programming is pretty intuitive. All in all, it's not bad. Just seems to have some odd behavior.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: You have to provide personal Information....
customer_reviews.text: This is a remote control to turn on and control your devices. It works very well for those purposes and the app is very easy to use... However, why would they need you to create an account and give your email address? There must be an option to opt out of creating an account. I just gave a fake email and moved on. But, I have extreme negative feeling toward companies asking for all kind of information just to get some basic item or service. You go shopping (or get a haircut), they want your zip code, your phone number.... Overall I am happy with all my logitech products, but very much hate their "must create an account" attitude!
customer_reviews.author: F. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Harmony 650
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first Harmony 650 about five years ago. After much daily use and abuse some of the buttons would not respond properly. So I researched articles on which multi purpose remote to buy. And I came right back to the 650.its a Classic! First, the setup, where you link all your devices into activities, is seamless. Really it’s fun. Once set up the remote will troubleshoot and correct any problems. And when you change devices Harmony just walks you through it. Buy a new remote like I did? No problem. Harmony has a feature to set it up. Why buy the same remote after five years? Nobody has improved on it.
customer_reviews.author: john McE

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as an extra -- these are the best
customer_reviews.text: Whenever anyone complains, "Why can't I just have one remote that controls everything?!" I always tell them about this remote. I've been a harmony user for over 10 years. They are GREAT once they are set up -- work with almost everything and are infinitely customizable. I've had this model for 5+ years and it has taken many tumbles onto my tile floor without breaking. The color of the buttons is wearing off so I purchased another one as a backup because I can't imagine running my AV system without one of these. I have it hooked up to control my TV, Receiver, cable box, Apple TV and Game console -- all seamless and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Big Hit With Mom
customer_reviews.text: I have introduced my mother to streaming services. She came in with an older tv and a cable box. I added a Roku and DVD player. She wasn't crazy about multiple remotes, and really struggled with the different tv inputs. With this, everything is programmed to work with one button. Be aware that you need to connect this to a PC to set it up, and there are minimum OS requirements. There wasn't anything more recent than an XP box in her house, so I had to take it home and bring it back. I have a Harmony hub at home that I love, which is paired with infrared transmitters to cover the whole house.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Vesel

customer_reviews.title: Great Harmony One Replacement
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Harmony remote I've purchased over the last 12 years. I had the Harmony One for years until my 2 year old broke the touch screen. Not ready to spend $200+ on another remote, i thought I'd give this a shot. Works perfectly with all of the devices in our living room (including the most current DirecTV HD DVR receiver, Xbox 360, and PS3 with adapter), was easy to program (even easier if you already have all of your devices in an existing Harmony account) and the activities work flawlessly. The LCD screen is bright and clear. The lit keys are soft to the touch, but firm and responsive. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BY

customer_reviews.title: Its junk dont buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Its not what I thought it would be its a really crapy remote it does not work unless you point it directly at what your using. The the delay witch i have played with is slow so if you press a button you have to wait forever for it to regustier the remote is junk!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a universal remote that could control a firestick, apple tv, and sound bar. This did the job. I remember going to a beach condo with my family and the place we rented, had one and I immediately fell in love with it. A few months later, I needed one, I researched it and this thing has been a lifesaver. Now instead of having 50 remotes, I just have the one and can control everything the way I need to.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Another great Harmony device
customer_reviews.text: Been a big fan of Harmony devices for almost 10 years now and this one continues the trend. It was easy to migrate from my old Harmony to this new one and it works great. I've docked one star for the artificial limits Logitech are putting on the number of devices you can control with the cheaper remotes. There is no actual reason for this other than to force you to purchase the more expensive remotes if you have more devices, even if you don't need any of the additional features.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Mohatarem

customer_reviews.title: Very poor with Samsung TVs and keeps resetting and losing all settings. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Samsung Smart TV a Yamaha receiver and an Arris / Verizon DVR and this remote has issues with all of them. Very disappointed. It's main issues are with the TV. The mapping of the buttons are so unintuitive or simply missing altogether. It's so cumbersome to switch devices and then scroll through to the command you want my wife has already given up on it. In addition to those issues it has now started resetting itself so forgets all commands and has to be plugged back into the laptop and re-configured. Sometimes it just gets stuck in a loop of resetting rendering it completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great remote
customer_reviews.text: The 650 works really great. Setup takes a little while but is extremely easy and very versatile. I had 1 problem: Sometimes I would accidently hit a wrong button and it would foul up what I was viewing. I needed to set some buttons to do nothing but that command didn't exist. Contacted support and within 1 day they resynced my remote so those buttons did nothing. And they added "No Function" to my list of possible buttons commands. My only complaint is the "OK" button. Way too small. I was constantly hitting the Up/Down button instead of the OK button. Easy fix: reassigned the Yellow button to Select/OK.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this to all my clients and use this myself at home. The programming software is fairly straight forward. You’ll have to download the software from Logitech’s website first to get started. If you own an Apple Mac computer with OS X Catalina (64-bit) the Harmony software is not as feature rich as the Windows version, but has all the essential functionality. If your Mac is running any version prior to Catalina you can download an older version (that is 32-bit) with more features. Be aware that the most used buttons will wear out around a 2-year time frame so get the extended warranty and save yourself some money in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyJamzReads

customer_reviews.title: So buggy
customer_reviews.text: I would really avoid this product at all costs. The idea is great, but in reality it just doesnt work as intended. Every single time I want to enjoy some Netflix I have to run through the help wizard just to turn on or off my devices. You would think after 10x the remote would learn. It doesnt. Also the software is the most buggy software i have ever used; and they force you to create an account or sign in with a gmail address. Just do yourself a favor and save your money for something that works.
customer_reviews.author: ES_Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect remote
customer_reviews.text: We love this remote. Bought it to replace our last harmony 650. It was such an easy set up...we were able to import all of the settings from our prior Harmony 650 & it worked great. I do wish it gave a warning when the battery was about to die. I thought I saw a message the first time the batteries were dying, but haven't had a warning since. And it's EATING the cheap batteries that we accidentally bought. I'm hoping that this will get better (and maybe the warning msg will come back) when we buy long-life batteries.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: I now have 5 of these, one for each TV.
customer_reviews.text: I now have 5 of these, one for each TV. These days everyone has an HDTV, with or without an off the air receiver, a blu ray player, and cable or satellite. Normal, not techie/non teenager people can't or really don't want to juggle several remotes. In fact most of those in this group would not know which remote to grab, especially when a function requires more than one remote to accomplish that function (like watch a movie, watch TV, etc.) In my living room, family room (our real movie room w/a HD projector), we have a Surround Sound system as well.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Seigneur

customer_reviews.title: Saved our marriage :)
customer_reviews.text: This stopped our fights. My husband is particular about what kind of sound system and equipment we have, but I was really tired of the 4 remotes and the synchronized steps every time I wanted to go from tv to netflix or to the old fashioned dvd discs. We bought it, he set up, and voila, married life is good again. One thing to note is that, every now and then, the Apple TV does an upgrade and the remote doesn’t catch on. Give it some time, and starts working again.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: I also hate this remote.
customer_reviews.text: We don't get all those great reviews. We have tried to fix/reprogram this remote numerous times to no avail. Minimally, I have to turn on cable manually. Nowadays, it is freezing up so we cannot even use sound control. I've had enough. Here to get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 650 about three years ago and I just ordered a replacement for it. Overall it's a pretty good product. It works correctly about 95% of the time. When it doesn't work, it has a self correcting feature that walks through the devices to make sure the right ones are on or off. If you have a home entertainment system with multiple components, having the one remote is definitely a boon. Just be aware that the device doesn't last too long and a replacement became necessary after three years when the "off" button stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: westie1

customer_reviews.title: Quick, flawless setup
customer_reviews.text: My receiver remote-control volume button stopped working so I thought I'd risk this all-in-one to replace it and my TV and cable-box remote-control units. With trepidation, I started on the setup via their on-line software (I HATE tedious activities like this that often have multiple frustrating problems and turn into nightmares). I'll be darned if it didn't actually work perfectly the first time--about a half hour from opening the box to all my devices working perfectly on one remote-control device. I can't find anything that I need to do on any device that isn't available on this nifty little unit--awesome.
customer_reviews.author: nicknamesalreadytaken

customer_reviews.title: Keeps resetting itself, very frustrating; would not buy this remote again
customer_reviews.text: I had a Logitech remote before (same model) that worked beautifully but this one keeps resetting itself and it's very frustrating. There's an initial menu that familiarizes you with the buttons on the remote and it keeps going back to this procedure even though I've already gone through it. I've tried resetting the remote and replacing the batteries with new ones, but the menu keeps coming up. These remotes are great when they work because they can be programmed to turn on several devices as a group at the same time, but because of this glitch that keeps occurring, I would not buy this remote again. Switching to a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Alec

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Now that there are a couple of other versions out, this is a HUGE value now. Originally over $100, that would be crazy. I did not want any smart device or app or any of that other silly stuff with this remote. I only wanted a remote to control the TV, sound bar and the DVR - simple! I could have added a couple of other things but didn't need to. The setup process was a little more difficult then I initially thought/expected so if you are tech-savy, great. Else look for a child/grandchild to set this up for you. It will take some getting use to but if 1 remote is a necessity, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Best $50. I spent...
customer_reviews.text: First let me say it's the best $50 ever spent. The reason why I gave it four stars is that although, it was easy setting up once I connected it to my computer I had some confusion with how to add all my items. So, I feel that you have to be slightly techie or have somebody that understands Tech to set this remote up. It does not have connection with non IR, so I had to get an adapter for my 2017 16gb Nvidia Shield ( the 500 gigabyte Nvidia Shield does have IR). Also Amazon stick does not have IR. But, all my other remotes work including Roku 4K.
customer_reviews.author: LoFi

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: My husband did a lot of research before we purchased this universal remote. We have a cable box, a sound bar and a TV that needed to be controlled with one remote. The remote worked well for about a week before it would randomly turn off and on and then watch TV function never worked properly to turn all of our devices on and off at the same time. We reprogrammed and reset the remote a few times. Now it turns off and restarts whenever you press a button so now we still don't have a remote and we're out $65. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany VanLanen

customer_reviews.title: A robust, IR-only universal remote.
customer_reviews.text: I had a much older 550 that I could no longer update. I looked at a few of the newer Logitech options but started reading about Logitech bricking units by forcing certain things to be online-only. I can understand the security implications, but it made me leery of buying into a system that could be broken at any time. This is a perfect replacement for the 550 and does everything that I need it to do. Surprisingly, even a couple of Chinese media players were recognized by the remote without me having to do any programming.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cumpian

customer_reviews.title: I like it but.....
customer_reviews.text: I like the remote so far but last night while watching a movie it stopped working. Even though it appeared to be on I put new batteries in it anyway and that didn't make any difference....it still wouldn't control anything. Today I went on My Harmony to try and troubleshoot the problem and followed the instructions to reboot it. After rebooting it was working again and at this time everything is fine. I really like the remote but I'm hoping this isn't a regular occurrence. If it is I may have to do an update later on at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Halfton57

customer_reviews.title: Took a little time, and a few tries to set up, but well worth the time and effort.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. It replaced the old Samsung remotes for my Samsung HD Smart TV, my Samsung Blu-Ray Disc player, and my Samsung Sound Bar, each of which required its own remote. It took me several tries, and a bit of time to program it properly, but now it works great and its nice to have only one remote to deal with. The buttons are a little small, and the lettering a little difficult for these senior citizen eyes and fingers, but it was well worth the price, and time spent to get it working right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT, BIG improvement over earlier model...
customer_reviews.text: last one I purchased was the 880 model which 10 years ago was $200 plus set-up fee. Worked great until over time I made changes to the system--was difficult to program so give up and used several remotes.. Saw this model under $40 and seems like it would work--IT DID!! Fast and logical programming and did all my activities--very happy! Still learning my two screaming device's controls, but can can do basics and will figure the rest out as I go.. Bit large, but getting use to it.. Highly recommend....
customer_reviews.author: Product User

customer_reviews.title: Product is great but don't bother with tech support. Use google.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second remote that I have gotten of this brand. We love the ease of features and setup and it has worked perfectly with every device with the exception of the Comcast/Xfinity X-one dvr box. It controls all of the features except for being able to turn it off. Tech support was a waste of lots of time reprograming the remote multiple times and being able to turn the dvr off still does not work and the techs could not seem to figure it out. I would be supprised if the tech could figure out how to tie his shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A nice way to get rid of remotes and add features ...
customer_reviews.text: A nice way to get rid of remotes and add features that may not have been available on old remotes. It seems like the ability for it to work on brands is almost limitless since the information is downloaded from their site. Super easy to install, no problems on my Apple computer, no problems with my Apple TV either. My only complaint is that it doesn't automatically switch devices when I press the volume up/down, even though you tell the remote what specific device controls the volume. A small learning curve for a great remote. No experience at this point with cable boxes, but a friend who has cable tv and this remote has no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: WIFE HATED IT AND THEN IT BROKE
customer_reviews.text: The remote setup was actually fairly easy and it usually worked well. Had it set up to control a TV, cable box and receiver to power external speakers. The annoying part is having to point the remote at your IR repeater or equipment for upwards of ten seconds to ensure all components turned on. I got used to it but the wife found it frustrating and guests never got it right resulting in me having to shut everything off and restart on numerous occasions. After about a year, the remote would randomly start forcing you to go step by step through the intro sequence which could not be exited. Unusable at present. Probably not going to purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Teske

customer_reviews.title: It may be good, I just don't see how.
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work to turn on/off my Logitech sound system half the time (it even told me it was having issues with it). It also wouldn't work very well with the new AFN DVR decoder. I know it's newer, but I did update the remote via the internet, so you would think by now it would be fixed. It also started rebooting upon a press of any button (randomly) and that was the final straw. Finally, I didn't like how I couldn't just tell it (easily) to turn on the TV, or turn on the audio, or change the audio when the remote doesn't know the TV is already on. It just wasn't user friendly enough I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Cheapo

customer_reviews.title: A challenge at first
customer_reviews.text: It took me about a week to get this remote to work properly. I am tech/ home theater savvy. Most of the activity commands did not work properly with my DISH/Sharp TV set-up. The remote asks questions when you press the help button and eventually fixes the problem once. The problem persists on next activity command though. The remote does not learn from it's mistakes. At any rate, I had to change the settings on the devices in the Harmony program on the PC and things are working much better now. On the plus side, it works well an external sound card/ Sangean Digital tuner and everything else now. Just be prepared to run into some issues possibly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 5 months until failure
customer_reviews.text: Remote worked pretty well until it completely died after 5 months. We had trouble with certain devices missing the "on" command, but the help feature fixes it quickly. Over the past couple of months the remote stopped functioning properly like randomly rebooting or no LED screen at all. I like this remote (especially the customization!), but I think this starter-version is good but not great. My next purchase will probably be an upgraded version. I definitely expected this remote to last longer than my cable companies!
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone down a bit.
customer_reviews.text: I am on my 2nd Harmony. Very happy with the 1st one as it lasted 3/4 years until it became hard to press the buttons. This 2nd one for some reason seems to be wearing out much faster just after one year. Not only are the buttons coating coming off after about a year, batteries don’t last long either. And occasionally the buttons on the left/right of the screen get stuck. A bit disappointed that quality has slipped quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: J from M

customer_reviews.title: Did not do the job in my case.
customer_reviews.text: It was not difficult to enter my devices. In that regard their software was impressively good. However, when I programed my "Activities" ( watch TV, watch a movie ) this gadget didn't do the job. I had some good emails with their customer support and they were able to send a fix over the internet, but my problems persisted. I wanted to watch TV, watch movies on my DVD player and stream Netflix. I could watch TV but the TV's control was easier to use. I could not do the other two things. Please bear in mind that this product has been well reviewed by others. I look forward to the day when Logitech puts out a better project.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: All your controllers in one!
customer_reviews.text: So far it controls all my devices with a single touch, you push tv and it will turn on all the assoc. devices to run the tv and audio receivers etc. want to watch a movie and it will turn on all your devices including the blue ray player/dvd, tv, amp, receiver, and what ever else you want on! You will need to establish an online account for the remote to update and help you organize your devices. Make sure you have your serial numbers written down before doing the online portion, it will help a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Tapscott

customer_reviews.title: Easy!
customer_reviews.text: I like this remote a lot for the price. Its super easy to set up and the web interface to it is easy to use. Surprisingly enough it took less than 5 minutes to set up and seems to sufficiently control a large variety of devices. Have purchased two of these, one for living room and one for the bedroom which is nice to go down from 3 remotes to one in each room.
customer_reviews.author: Tom P.

customer_reviews.title: Remote Controls Everything in an Integrated Fashion
customer_reviews.text: This remote does what it says and then some. It takes a while through trial and error to figure out all of the powers of this remote, but once you figure it out, it works flawlessly. This remotes seems to be able to control absolutely everything under the sun: I even programmed it to control my iPod clock radio! The only downside is that the software that programs the remote is built on software that is deprecated by the software maker. So, it is unclear whether the software will work under future operating systems. If Logitech converts to a simple web-based interface where we can use any web browser, then this product will earn five stars instead of four.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Replaced our Harmony 1
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know it was possible for a remote to make you happy, but it has!!! Our Harmony 1 was giving us fits and after a drop by 1 year old it was done. I love how simple it is and everything that we had to program into the Harmony 1 it just at the reach of a button with this one. I love that there is no charging doc for the remote and just have a change a battery if it dies. We always had to have our other remotes available incase the Harmony was put on it charger. It works seamlessly with the Direct TV, Samsung TV/Blue Ray, and Sanos surround.
customer_reviews.author: tiffersben

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware, online confguration could be better
customer_reviews.text: If you prefer the simpler older Harmony remotes, then this is a great model. I liked the old online remote configuration program better than the new one. There was more flexibility in the way you could customize settings unique to your environment. Also I had to create a whole new configuration because my old remove controlled more devices than the replacement remote. It took me several years to get it just right. It would be nice if they allowed you to remove a device and transfer the configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: I have 4 of these...
customer_reviews.text: I love these remotes and have been using them for years. Programming them is relatively simple and they just work very well. They're not fancy, they don't have all the bells and whistles that some of the newer Logitech Universal remotes have, but these older 650s just work.
customer_reviews.author: The Slayer

customer_reviews.title: Patience! It will be great if you are patient.
customer_reviews.text: No more pressing a different "boss" button before you are able to control the various aspects of your home theater (volume, cable, DVD, FM, etc.). Just be patient and go through the setup and sync process. And then, as I did, write to (or call) the tech support folks and have them iron out any issues that still exist. And then, perhaps, contact them again to address another issue. But, if you are patient, as I have been, you will have a product that works great!
customer_reviews.author: lalawsooner

customer_reviews.title: only one remote
customer_reviews.text: This is my first remote where I can truly say that it is a substitute for all the other remotes I use. The programming requires you to connect it to your computer and you need to set up an account after knowing the model number of all your audio and video devices. I have a 5.1 receiver, TV, apple-TV, and DVD player and this remote controls all of them pretty well. You don't need to enter code numbers to program it like other universal remotes. The software asks you how you have each device configured and which device you controls the sound and it programs the remote. Working well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Xcentric-1

customer_reviews.title: Works but sucks up batteries and not built to last
customer_reviews.text: It does operate multiple devices and works well, but . . . I've had this a little less than 2 years and the thing sucks up batteries like I don't know what. Seems like I have to replace batteries every couple of weeks. Also, if you barely tap the remote it resets itself and you have to go though the setup menus before you can use it again. At this point I'm ready to smash the thing so if you want something that lasts I'd stay away from this model. Note: I previously had the 700 series model that lasted several years and had rechargeable batteries and the thing worked great.
customer_reviews.author: J. DFW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for my old Harmony one.
customer_reviews.text: I’m thrilled with this for the price. We had a Harmony for years that died and that’s ok we got out money out of it. So I went to replace it and got their most expensive one and couldn’t get it to work, so returned it and bought this one almost least expensive and it worked right away! Couldn’t be more pleased. The other does whole house stuff, thermostats,lights, voice integration and I need none of those things. So we went simple with the 650 and it works just right. Gave four stars instead of five only because it doesn’t change channels when using roku, if I get that fixed I’ll change it to five. Love this item.
customer_reviews.author: s33flyer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible features and easy to use software take the time to get used to it!
customer_reviews.text: Smart TV and Soundbar all turn on with a click of a button. It takes some planning. I have an android box and so mapping out the key for that was easy. Whats complicated is if I just want FIOS TV with the TV audio or if I want the additional volume of the soundbar for movies. SO I had to create two similar configurations. This remote is faster than the stock Verizon Remotes and even the TV remote. Before if you pressed guide or DVR you'd have to wait a second or you would get frustrated by canceling what you were trying to do. This remote response for is INSTANT!
customer_reviews.author: W. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good update but mixed service experience
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing a much loved 880 remote. This one has matched the function pretty well. I found the smaller buttons and display a bit off-putting, but got used to them. More seriously, migrating from the 880 to the 650 took a call to customer service to resolve the migration from their old support software to the new site. The support person was very good and quick, but the migration could have been made more seamless. Logitech save on one side and is spending the gain on support.
customer_reviews.author: J. Duggan

customer_reviews.title: Excelent remote for complex home  theater
customer_reviews.text: Nice compromise on price and features. Excellent universal remote for complex home entertainment. Can program multiple setups fairly easy using computer based setup (no more guessing 3 digit codes). Pretty durable, just replaced one several years old as its buttons were getting a bit suspect but still worked. Just adding some tablet based/chromecast and Fire TV to my theater and it is simple to just make new entries for these. Suggest adding glow in dark strips to help find at night. Suggest rechargeable batteries (does last a fair while on a battery set though). Annoying that is not convenient to change order in which items are displayed in video panel
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good not great.
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these remotes in different rooms, overall they are fine. My frustration is they tend to reset themselves if you bump them. They seem extremely sensitive to the slightest impact. I use one in the basement where I workout. When I place it in the drink holder on my elliptical it often resets. I have checked the battery connection and it's fine on all of them. The one in the living room will do the same thing if you drop it on a pillow on the couch. These remotes are way to sensitive in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: L. Troy

customer_reviews.title: absolutely worthless
customer_reviews.text: Original Denon/Sony remotes broken/lost...after spending hours downloading, registering, inputting model numbers, and trouble shooting, 2 of 5 devices can now be switched on/off. No volume/channel/input source/ff/rew etc. remote controls function. Logitech's automated troubleshooting software requires that a functional original remote to "teach" the Logitech 650, which makes the Logitech device worthless if the original device is non-functional...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised. So far, I have added an old Panasonic VCR, Sony CD changer, TCL TV, LG DVD player, Yamaha soundbar and Pioneer receiver. It works with all of them, even the more obscure buttons. If it does not have a certain button, you can map another button to do what you need it to... Setup is done through your computer and you can make advanced multi-step macros with pauses. Well worth the money to finally have a single remote that does it all.
customer_reviews.author: joeg

customer_reviews.title: Too unreliable to bother with
customer_reviews.text: This remote works ok when it wants to; however, it will often reset itself back into its tutorial mode for no apparent reason, sometimes multiple times a day, and make you click through about ten different prompts before it's usable. Searching online I found that this is not fixable. It really isn't worth the trouble and frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Bdub

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as it seemed like it would be
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping this would solve all of our families problems with having three remotes, but i would say it actually just created a new more complicated issue. The volume button never "always" controls my amplifier, i have to actually select amplifier then change the volume. Ok well you can sit here for hours trying to program it and maybe it will mostly do what you want to do. I cant get it to make Roku navigation simple at all, when the actual remote has only a few buttons. My wife who is technology challenged cant even figure how to to play a show in Netflix, which should be extremely simple and it is much simpler with all three remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Boof

customer_reviews.title: Absolute rubbish
customer_reviews.text: I had this remote for 8 years. It NEVER worked properly. Literally, everyday, I would need to reprogram in through it's "help" system. I thought it would eventually learn, but it never did. I reprogramed it via the software, but that didn't help either. Why did I keep it so long? Because I paid $60 for it and couldn't return it. I just accepted it's flaws. My wife always hated it though. I just replace it though, with a $7 remote that doesn't have all the BS on it like the Logitech remote. I'd rather have to use two remotes that work, than one that doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Rhidan

customer_reviews.title: Slippery, battery bounce, slow.
customer_reviews.text: Meh. Not as good as other models (discontinued), falls off things all the time due to odd shape. Then, the batteries bounce, loose contact and it restarts. It's a computer. A slow one and it takes a good while to restart. The weakest IR transmitter of any remote I have had. Never turns on some devices the first time. Ever. Updated: even worse. It power cycles just sitting there. So then you have to restart it (covering the IR transmitter) to do something simple like pause the show so you can get up. Liked their previous models, this is terrible, and not this instance. We've had several replacements under warranty and they are all junk.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hoober

customer_reviews.title: Best remote for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Harmony 650. The first lasted seven or eight years. It is easy to program with their website. It is compatible with almost any TV and it's associated devices. I have a Blu-Ray player, an amplifier with surround speakers and a cable box. All work in harmony (see what I did there) with this remote. The batteries last a month or two. After a few years the buttons will start to stick, though it takes a lot of wear to get to that point. All in all, this is a solid buy.
customer_reviews.author: Terry R.

customer_reviews.title: dont buy...not worth it
customer_reviews.text: remote works but will not stay in sync with my tv, sound bar, and cable box.. when I power it on usually only one or two will power on and the same will happen when turning it off....then you have to go through the troubleshoot Q&A's....not worth the hassle and we don't use it...it just sits in the drawer and we use the cable remote for volume and channel and the tv remote to power on the tv and search with it (smart tv)
